message: Wording change
Spelling correction
[[WP:AES|←]]Created page with '{{subst:SPI report |checkuser=yes <!--If you want to request checkuser, simply change the line above this comment to checkuser=yes  For the list of suspected soc...'
Opened RfC
Again, shall we reach a consensus on the talk page first before we slander a civil rights group?
Shall we avoid labelling AfriForum as a white nationalist organisation until a consensus is reached on the talk page?
Update regarding AfriForum's assistance of the Ndebele Vaaltyn tribe.
Straight from the AfriForum website: AfriForum is a non-governmental organisation, registered as a non-profit company, with the aim of protecting the rights of minorities.

Added many reputable sources that state verbatim that AfriForum is a civil rights organization. These include articles stating AfriForum's condemnation of racist Dan Roodt, their intent to prosecute Grace Mugabe over her assault of a black lady, and their taking on the case of the Ndebele Vaaltyn Tribe who in 2014 brought criminal charges against Canadian mining company Ivanplats Mines Ltd.

Reverting claim that AfriForum is a White Nationalist organisation with single citation of Eikonline? supporting this claim which completely misrepresents AfriForum's position on the apartheid SA flag in it's headline. If you actually read the article it says "AfriForum believes that the flag should be restricted, just as is the case in Germany with regard to Nazi symbolism, and that it should only be seen “in museums, documentaries and cathartic creative works” Hardly white nationalist position
Changed subheading titles

Created sub-sections for the 'racism against white communities' section. Removed the Tarlton tractor case as the presiding Magistrate stated the act was not racist and inserted "alleged" where convictions have not occurred.
Included the racially motivated torture murder of Alice and Helen Lotter
Added a space between 2 sentences
Updated details on Julius Malema's anti-Indian statements during a 2017 EFF rally
Removed broken citation and added [Citation needed] tag to the first sentence
Added some links and made some wording alterations to make the article read better.
/* RFC on Racism in SA */ new section

Admin NeilN locked the page on the correct version where each group is listed in a distinct category. If you believe that Indian and Coloured people are not conventially considered black then please log a DRR.

Admin NeilN locked the page on the correct version where each group is listed in a distinct category. If you are unable to accept that Indian and Coloured people are not conventially considered black then please log a DRR. Instigating an edit war will likely get you banned at this point.

Revert of edits which include stating the Dept of Labour's idealized aspirations for BEE as fact "Thus the skills and qualifications of the workforce is not compromised and remains equitable and competitive", grammatical inaccuracies such as ", instead unpliftment of the majority of the black community." and subjective statements such as "despite qualifications being an important criteria of the system".
Revert of insertion of unsourced and potentially non-neutral information

Removed 2 cases without CLEAR indication of racism (no clear racial motivation could be established from the citations as no racist language was used etc). Is the standard for racism merely the fact that one individual attacked another of a different race? Also, Indian/Coloured people are NOT black.
Removing poorly written paragraph with no clear indication of racism and broken citations

Removed poorly written paragraph with NO CLEAR INDICATION OF RACISM. Saying that people that don't speak a certain language are aliens is possibly tribalist, but not racist. There are many black people that speak Afrikaans, and most Afrikaans speakers are coloured. What if they had said the same thing to a white English speaker? Had they said 'black people are aliens' it would be clearly racist. Now is every time a white is assaulted/murdered by a black person automatically a case of racism too?

I don't see anywhere where it said black people don't belong. The man allegedly said "anyone who doesn't speak Afrikaans is an alien to the area". There are lots of black people in SA who speak Afrikaans, and many white people who can't speak a word of Afrikaans. Language does not equal race. Also, the paragraph is poorly written. Again, Indian people are not considered black in South Africa.

Removed paragraph which has no clear indication of racism (no racist words were used etc) and reverted the completely incorrect grouping of Indian and coloured people as black. Nowhere on the talk page was a consensus reached. No one has been able to explain why Indians and Coloureds are considered distinct ethnic groups in the National Census, or referred to as distinct groups in prominent news sources or by politicians or other prominent people.

Reverted edit which goes against the talk page consensus on who is considered 'black' in SA. Also includes unnecessary & didatic paragraph to attempt to justify why all people who aren't white are black.
Included the phrase 'alleged' where necessary

Removed another subjective sentence which read "In 2017 there have been numerous cases of white on black racism." The word 'numerous' is relative and the claim is unsourced and unnecessary to the reader.
Removed subjective, poorly worded and unsourced intro sentence from the 'Racism against Black African communities' section
Removed opinionated and defamatory paragraph, which violates NPOV, contains unfounded allegations and has the sole citation of an opinion piece from the article
[[WP:AES|←]]Created page with 'Welcome to Wikipedia, DumaTorpedo!'
Reverted edits where it is incorrectly stated that Indian/Asian and coloured people are considered black.

Apologies, last edit should read: Again restored content (MP and polemecist Gwen Ngwenya's comment on anti-white racism treatment of Black SA'ns as victims) to the page which seems valid but was removed at some point

Again restored content (MP and polemecist Gwen Ngwenya's comment on anti-white racism treatment of Black SA) to the page from the 'anti-white racism section' which seems valid but was removed at some point
Again restored content from the page in the post-apartheid racism section which was removed at some point

Reverted the content of Ed Herbst's comment in the 'Racism against white communities' state to it's original state. Not sure why the sentence "the victims of which are predominantly white" was removed
Changed wording of 'non-racist' to 'non-racial dispensation'

Reverted edit which incorrectly includes certain groups as black. The edit also includes content which is poorly worded such as "Publichumiliation against blackapeople", "restaurants dive .atAt group" and "nearStellenbosch, in responseD to this r a black student". It also contains content which does not correspond with the citations such as "motive was allegedly due to him dating a white girl" which is not stated in the citations. The edit also includes cases with no obvious indication of racism
Removed incident with no clear indication of racism
Again, included the phrase allegedly where necessary
Edited the Tumi Mpofu case to make it more clear what was stated by Mpofu
Included the phrase "alleged" where necessary in the Stellenbosch case

Removed the case of the assault/rape in Jan Hensdorp which had no indication of racism in the citations (ie: no racist words were used during the attack etc). Also, I could not find where it was ascertained that the motive was due to the victim dating a white girl.
Again, Coloureds, Indians and Asians are NOT black.
Revert. Jews, Indians, Asians and Coloureds are NOT black
Revert. Islam is not a race

Undid the completely nonsensical grouping of the racism against Indian and coloured communities sections from the racism against black communities section as the racism directed at Indians and coloureds has been by BLACK communities
Included the FW de Klerk Foundations complaint to the HRC regarding 45 anti-white hate speech on social media
Included the case of the 2009 Port Alfred rape of a pregnant white woman
Included the case of 'drunk judge' Motala in the anti-white racism section

Undid the completely nonsensical grouping of the racism against Indian and coloured communities sections from the racism against black communities section as the racism directed at Indians and coloureds has been by BLACK communities.
Jews are a race
Updated the case regarding Wayne Blaauw's murder with his neighbour's original Afrikaans quote with the English translation
Included the year of Wayne Blaauw's murder
Updated the Wayne Blaauw murder case with more information
changed community to settlement

Included a section for racism against coloured communities in SA and included the apparent hate crime murder of Wayne Blaauw. Also renamed the racism against black communities section to racism against Black African communities to provide clarity and end the ongoing edit war on the page.
Check the talk page
Forgot my signature
Included a discussion on whether Indians are considered 'black' in contemporary SA
/* A barnstar for you! */ new WikiLove message

Further revert to unmerge the post-apartheid racism against Indian & black people. It is NOT the norm in SA for Indian people to be considered black and until evidence can be provided that proves otherwise please stop merging these sections.

Reverted edit where the opinions of prominent SA'n commentators & specialists were removed from the page. Herbst du Preez, Wikipedia encourages the inclusion of many views in a discussion. Your duty as an editor is to ensure your contributions are free of YOUR OWN personal opinions. You may include the opinions of others provided it is made clear who's opinion it is and that they are prominent or specialized enough to warrant inclusion. Please read the Wiki guidelines on neutrality.

South African English does not refer to Indian people as black. From personal experience in having lived in Durban for over 20 years and having daily contact with many Indian friends and acquantances over the years I have only ever heard Indian people referring to themselves as 'Indian' or the colloquial 'charou.' I have lived never heard a black, coloured or white person refer to Indian people as black either. Please provide proof to justify your statement.

Undid edit where a citation to regarding the HRC complaint was removed and the racism against Indian communities section was incorrectly merged with that of racism against black communities. Please see the talk page.

No, Carte Blanche was removed as the citation link was broken. There is absolutely nothing wrong with the opinion of prominent SPECIALISTS such as that of veteran political and economic commentator RW Johnson or retired SC Judge van Schalkwyk. However, your duty as an editor is to make changes that are objective and free of YOUR personal opinion or bias. Please read the Five Pillars of Wikipedia, namely the pillar referring to neutrality.

Undid revision 834007458 by DumaTorpedo where blatant cases of anti-white racism have been deleted. Indian communities are considered a distinct ethnic group under AA/EE laws and in the national census, not sure where DumaTorpedo got the idea they are considered Black in South Africa.
Added Velaphi Khumalo case to Racism against whites section
Updated the "Racism against white communities" section with the murders of Janine and baby Kayla Drennan where the killer stated he committed the crime because they were white
corrected 'women' to 'woman'
Updated "Racism against white communities" section with the attack on farmer Nicci Simpson.
Updated the "Racism against white communities" section with an alleged 2011 rape of a family where one of the perpetrators indicated an racist motivation to the crime.
Updated the Tarlton 'tractor case' with a statement from the presiding Magistrate

Removed a sentence in the "Racism against black communities section" stating "In eShowa a black man was shot by a security guard for fishing in a river on a farm". There was no indication of racism whatsoever in this case as the owner of the farm was also black. An uMlalazi Municipality official stated it was not a racially motivated attack https://www.iol.co.za/dailynews/eshowe-farms-torched-after-mans-death-13856375
Removed line saying that "a clear racial motive was found" wrt. the coffin case. It does not state anywhere in the source that racism had anything to do with this case.
Updated my page
Added a paragraph on convicted racist murderer Knowledge Mandlazi in the racism against white communities section
Included the phrase 'alleged' in the 'Racism against black communities (post-Apartheid)' section where proven facts are not provided.

Again, classification of individuals into specific communities has no relevance to this discussion. Your categorization of people into 3 communities is an attempt to portray as if racism ONLY exists between communities. That is just not true. There is absolutely no proof for example, that Racist attacks on Asians came specifically from Jewish or White communities. Please provide references to support your claims.
Restoring to original consensus
